availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Erastus "Tuce" Lambden (Maysville, Mason County, Kentucky, saloon keeper)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, barkeeper and liquor retailer. Kentucky native. Barkeeper in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1863. Liquor retailer in Mason County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 422B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 330B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mason County, KY, September 1863, p. 214.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 16, Mason County, Kentucky, 1864, p. 114.
"Sporting Man is Found Dead," The Cincinnati Post (Cincinnati, OH), September 4, 1906, p. 2.
"'Tuce' Lambden Dead," Daily Public Ledger (Maysville, KY), September 4, 1906, p. 1.
